title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.10.13 | 01-06-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञानति मिरान्दस्य ज्ञानांजलिषलाकया चक्षरुन्मेलितं येनातस्मै श्री गुरवे नमः
नमा ओम विष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्रीमते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्निति नामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गौरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेशा शुन्यवादी पाश्चात्यदेशतारिने जाय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभू नित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैत गदाधरा श्रीवासाधी गौरभक्त वृन्दा

Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deviim Sarasvatim Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 13th verse of the 10th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Sarvete Anmishai Rakshaihi Tam Anudruta Chetasaha Vikshanta Sneha Sambaddha Vichelus Tatra Tatraha
The meaning of this verse is, all their hearts were melting for him on the pot of attraction.
They looked at him without blinking their eyes and they moved hither and thither in perplexity.
What happened to all those?
Those who were attached to Krishna when Krishna left Hastinapura.
That is being described here.
They felt so much of separation.
They were constantly looking at Krishna without blinking their eyes, constantly staring at him.
And they don't know what to do, how to.
Even.
They continue their normal activities in the absence of Krishna.
So, within the core of their heart they were feeling that, we are going to miss Krishna.
It's not a superficial feeling.
Unlike material feelings, it's all superficial.
Because we know, our experience says in this material world,
however much somebody will be afflicted by some pain,
or suffering,
they can be pacified.
Or they tend to forget that in course of time.
Sometimes they say time is the best healer.
Of some pain of suffering or loss or bereavement, somebody suffers.
With time they forget that.
But that is not the case with attachment to Krishna, attraction for Krishna.
That we have to understand.
Attraction or attachment for Krishna is an eternal thing.
It is a spiritual feeling, spiritual attraction.
It is not material.
Krishna is not a material personality.
Krishna is not having any material relationship with anyone.
It's only spiritual relationship, spiritual attraction.
So, therefore it is different.
And the purport Srila Prabhupada explains,
Krishna is naturally attractive for all living beings because he is the chief eternal amongst all eternals.
He is the chief.
Krishna is the chief among all the eternal conscious beings, living beings.
Krishna is the chief, the topmost and the supreme.
He alone is the maintainer of the many eternals.
This is stated in the Kathopanishad.
The
this
This can be lived here and there.
So that they can do, he can live.
service by chanting harikrishna then our eternal relation with krishna is revived
nitya siddha krishna prema sadhya kabunai it is not something to be externally
imposed this love for krishna or relationship with krishna it is revived within by the process
of bhakti
once this relation is slightly revived the conditioned soul at once becomes free from
the illusion of maya and living being such a living being who becomes free from the illusion
of maya and is reviving even slightly the eternal relationship then such a person becomes mad after
association of krishna one becomes almost like that
so this association with krishna is made possible not only by personal contact
with krishna but also by association with krishna's name krishna's fame krishna's pastime
krishna's activities krishna's qualities krishna's
paraphernalia krishna's devotees pure devotees any of these also can
help us to revive our eternal relationship with krishna
so srimad bhagavatam is a special literature which trains the conditioned soul to this stage
of perfection by submissive hearing from the pure devotees and by listening to the pure devotees

So, what do you have to do to revive your eternal relationship with Krishna? Everyone has an eternal relationship, every living being without exception. So, to revive that, what do you have got to do?

Prabhupada says here, Bhagavatam trains you, that you simply submissively hear the Bhagavatam from the pure devotee regularly, you keep on hearing, hearing, hearing, hearing, hearing, hearing, your eternal relation with Krishna is awakened, and then you become mad after Krishna, that is the result of hearing.
The fourteenth verse, it is said in this same chapter in the Bhagavatam,
Nyarundhan Udgalad Bhashpam, Outkantyad Devaki Sute, Niryati Agarano Abhadram, Itishyad Bandhavas Triyaha.
So, the meaning of this verse is,
The female,
The female relatives, whose eyes were flooded with tears out of anxiety for Krishna, came out of the palace.
They could not stop their tears, but they did so with great difficulty.
They feared, why did they stop their tears?
Because they feared that tears would cause misfortune at the time of departure.
So,
This is the description of the female relatives, who were present in that palace of Hastinapura.
How they felt separation from Krishna, that they began to shed tears, and with only great difficulty they could stop their tears from flowing.
So, Prabhupada explains that,
So, Prabhupada explains that,
So, Prabhupada explains a very important point here. Please, hear carefully.
There were hundreds of ladies in the palace of Hastinapura.
All of them were affectionate to Krishna.
How did they become affectionate to Krishna?
All of them were relatives also.
When they saw Krishna was going away from the palace for his native place,
They were very anxious for him.
And, as usual, tears began to roll down their cheeks.
Because there was so much attraction.
So, they were very anxious for Krishna.

They had so much affection for him, Krishna. They thought at the same time that tears at the time of Krishna's departure might be a cause of misfortune for Krishna. Therefore, they wanted to check them. But that was very difficult for them because the tears could not be checked.

Now, it is explained here that because it was difficult to stop their tears from flowing from their eyes, so they simply smeared their tears in their eyes and their hearts were throbbing with that intense feeling of separation from Krishna.
Now, these descriptions are significant because we can compare this with the kind of material relationships and attachments we have in this world, which is completely temporary.
It is superficial. It is conditional. It is only a maximum. It will exist only as long as the body exists.
And it is bewildering for the soul. All such material relationships are just bewilderment for the soul, for the conditioned soul.
So, there is no real value for that attachment or that relationship or some feelings. There is no value.
These material feelings, material relationships, material attachments, no value other than simply make us bewildered, that's all.
Entangle us in this material world.
Chase some illusory object. That's all it can do.
Whereas, Krishna is a transcendental personality. He is the transcendental personality.
We are all spiritual beings. We have an eternal relationship with him.
And in that eternal relationship, we are intimately attached and connected very intensely with Krishna.
Now, Prabhupada says, the ladies who were the wives and daughters-in-law of those who died in the battlefield never came in direct contact with Krishna.
That was the culture those days.
Women, they don't directly contact men except their own husband or their father like that, other than them.
Other men, they will not directly contact.
So, how is it that without direct contact with Krishna, they had so much of attachment for Krishna?
How is it possible?
That is explained here by Srila Prabhupada.
All of them heard of Krishna and his great activities.
And thus, they thought of him.
They talked about him.
They discussed about his name, fame, qualities.
Activities, past tense, etc.
And in that way, they developed affection for him.
Like the people who are in direct contact with Krishna.
To the same degree, they developed intense feeling of love for Krishna.
Just like those who are in direct touch with Krishna developed that feeling.
So, it is said here.
Therefore, directly or indirectly, anyone who thinks of Krishna, anyone who talks about Krishna, anyone who worships Krishna becomes attached to Krishna.
This is a fact.
So, don't practice bhakti as some mechanical thing.
As some mechanical activity.
Just like when we chant Hare Krishna on a daily basis.
Hare Krishna, Hare Krishna, Krishna Krishna, Hare Hare, Hare Rama, Hare Rama, Rama Rama, Hare Hare.
Don't do it so mechanically.
It comes in the way of our progress in developing.
Re-establishing our relationship with Krishna.
It comes in the way.
So, Krishna is absolute.
There is no difference between his name, form, quality, past times, etc.
No difference.
That's the meaning of absolute.
So, therefore, simply by hearing about Krishna.
Simply by talking of Krishna.
About Krishna.
Simply by reading about Krishna in the Bhagavatam.
Simply by thinking of Krishna.
Simply by remembering his past times.
We can revive our relationship of Krishna.
Our relationship with Krishna is revived that way.
It's a very, very powerful technique.
And the best method that is recommended in this age.
I'll stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
Thank you very much.
